info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTY THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 344 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near La Cienega, or 7 miles southwest of Santa Fe, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Tesuque and La Cienega. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 271 and 289. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
